No Unique Powers
Disables unique powers for all civilizations (recommended). Playing with unique powers is possible, but right now many civilizations receive generic powers instead of unique ones.

%D1: "We admire your glorious capital"
[ICON_BULLET]Farms in City Proximity (Fat Cross) Give an Additional [ICON_FOOD] Per %d1 Adjacent Farms Before the Discovery Of Biology
[ICON_BULLET]%s1%F2 from Unique Power
After years of following the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_CivicName[COLOR_REVERT] civic, a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s2_UnitName[COLOR_REVERT] has been born
[ICON_BULLET]Can Sacrifice this Unit in a City with Sacrificial Altar for %D1_Change[ICON_CULTURE] per Era, %D2_Change[ICON_GOLD] and Temporary Happiness in the City (Does Not Stack).
Sacrifice Slave
This order will sacrifice the Slave in the city they are currently in. It kills the Slave.
A Slave was sacrificed in %s1_city.
Double Eureka boost for ancient technologies.
+6[ICON_PRODUCTION] for sacrificing population with slavery. Gain slavery points for sacrificing population.
1 commerce of each type in capital per population over 5. No unhappiness in capital.

After playing with one non-starting government civic for 25 consequtive turns (on normal speed) before entering the Middle Ages, gain a great person. Applies once per civic. The great person depends on the civic: Autocracy -> Great General, City States -> Great Merchant, Dynasticism -> Great Engineer, Theocracy -> Great Artist, Republic -> Great Scientist.
Killing a land unit and advancing to its plot gives an Aztec Slave while playing Slavery.
+2[ICON_FOOD] from farm improved food resources like Rice, Wheat, Corn. 75% unhealthiness from population.

Farms are always irrigated even without fresh water and can be build without fresh water. Can remove Forest/Jungle from the start. Chopping Jungle gives production. Cities always have access to fresh water.
Cities with state religion receive 1[ICON_COMMERCE] per population over 5.
Can hurry military units with population. Great Military Instructors grant 2 additional experience to trained units.

After entering the Classical Era: Can trade with every known capital as long as not being at war with that player. Those traderoutes give +200%[ICON_COMMERCE]. Costs for hiring mercenaries are at 50%.

After entering the Classical Era: When conquering a city of a civilization that has not yet entered the medieval era, receive (cities culture level+1) military land units of that conquered civilization.
After entering the Classical Era: Cities gain +0.25[ICON_RESEARCH] and +0.25[ICON_CULTURE] per unimproved Forest in their territory.

After entering the Classical Era: Merchants +1[ICON_FOOD], Oasis +2[ICON_FOOD]. Building a Mine on a desert hill instantly discovers Gold if there is no adjacent Gold resource already. Double chance of discovering Gold with Mine improvements.
Unlocks unique [LINK=literal]Terrace[\LINK] improvement after discovery of Construction.

After the discovery of Exclusivism: Gain +20% strength for attacking cities of players with a different state religion (not secular states). State religion spreads to conquered cities and temples and monasteries are build automatically on conquest.

After entering the Medieval Era: Colonies with state religion pay 50% distance maintenance. +100% settler production for cities with state religion. After the discovery of Gundpowder: Gain a Conquistador when spreading state religion to a colony.

After the discovery of Gunpowder: Can conscript units without Conscription Civic and unhappiness in cities with less than 10% own culture. Conscripted units start with experience. Cities do not revolt when captured.
After the discovery of Corporation: Gain an additional resource from plantations. Trade routes contribute to Great Merchant birth (25% of trade income).
Other civilizations have +2 Attitude when Byzantine capital is more cultural advanced. After entering the Medieval Era: +2[ICON_ESPIONAGE] from state religion buildings.
Gain double Great General points from naval combat. After entering the Renaissance Era: +400%[ICON_COMMERCE] trade route income from oversea vassals.

After entering the Industrial Era: Trade routes with other players cities which have one or more corporations owned by America are at +600%[ICON_COMMERCE]. Double production for Corporation Executives.

After entering the Industrial Era: Can sacrifice a Great General to start a mini golden age that is 67% as long as a regular golden age. Does not require sacrificing other great persons and does not advance golden age requirements.
After entering the Industrial Era: +50%[ICON_RESEARCH] for techs that have been discovered by someone else.
Golden Ages last 40% longer. Land units have one additional movement during a Golden Age.
Units can heal by pillaging enemy tiles. After entering the Medieval Era: Enemy cities with less than Influential culture start revolting when a defender is killed by Mongols.
Starts with Eureka boost for Polytheism. +25% Great People birth for each Religion in a city. Actively spreading a religion never drives out existing religion of a city.
Land tiles adjacent to Peaks have +1[ICON_COMMERCE]. Cities founded on hills have +1[ICON_FOOD].
Ships with hidden nationality can pillage adjacent land tiles. Tundra tiles +1[ICON_COMMERCE].
Coastal Raid
Order the unit to pillage the selected land tile (counts as attack)
Coastal Raid
This order will pillage the improvement of target land tile (counts as attack).

After entering the Medieval Era: +100%[ICON_COMMERCE] from oversea trade routes. Trade missions grant 50% more [ICON_COMMERCE] for each instance of a happiness resource in trading city's fatcross that Portugal does not have access to without import trading.

After entering the Industrial Era: Towns provide +1[ICON_COMMERCE] for each three adjacent Towns. Great works give additional [ICON_COMMERCE] if target city has access to Hit Singles or Hit Movies (insufficient resources decrease [ICON_COMMERCE] bonus).
